message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.HC 

This paper is about designing spoken dialog systems that can conduct fluid interactions by incorporating cues from multiple modalities into turn-taking models. The paper proposes a multiscale RNN architecture to model modalities at separate timescales in a continuous manner. The paper's focus on spoken dialog systems and turn-taking modeling suggests that it belongs to the Natural Language Processing (NLP) sub-category (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper's use of machine learning techniques to model modalities and predict turn-taking suggests that it could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (AI) sub-category (cs.AI). The paper's focus on modeling temporal aspects of modalities suggests that it could also belong to the Signal Processing (SD) sub-category (cs.SD). The paper's use of machine learning techniques to model modalities and predict turn-taking suggests that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (LG) sub-category (cs.LG). Finally, the paper's focus on designing spoken dialog systems that can conduct fluid interactions suggests that it could also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) sub-category (cs.HC).
